thak you VAV!!!! becuase like me i know some dont read the describtion box haha VAV 5th Digital Single â€˜Senoritaâ€™In the year 2018, VAV have been  busy touring and actively visiting their fans all around the world from  United States, Brazil, Japan, Thailand and 10 others countries. Entering  Fall 2018, the boys are finally going to comeback with new track,  â€˜Senoritaâ€™ by transforming into a sexy yet passionate man.  VAV  5th Digital Single â€˜Senoritaâ€™ is actually a Korean rendition version of  mega hit track with the same title, named â€˜Senoritaâ€™. The song is  originally by Germany famous artist, Kay One featuring Pietro Lombardi.  Kay Oneâ€™s original version of â€˜Senoritaâ€™ is a bop song released back in  September 2017, not only gained 106M views in YouTube but also achieved  400K album sales in Germany and get awarded Gold & Platinum Records.  â€˜Senoritaâ€™ is a track started with addictive guitar intro, with Latin  melody and hip hop beat, where members Ayno and Lou also contributed in  the rap-making part. The producing of VAV rendition version of  â€˜Senoritaâ€™ involved both the original producer Stard Ova and K-POP Hit  Song maker Ryan Jhun, so fans can expect a high quality and promising  result.  VAVâ€™s â€˜Senoritaâ€™ is story-telling about 7 men who started  their passionate love-searching journey. Previous mini album title song  â€˜Spotlightâ€™ is an Urban R&B genre dance pop with Minor-code  progression, presenting a monotone-based modern chic style of VAV. Where  else in â€˜Senoritaâ€™, VAV transforms into a more mature and sexy style.  The concept photo of â€˜Senoritaâ€™ took place in desert and seaside, during  the sunset moment. VAV successfully demonstrated the emotion and glare  of a sexy passionate man, just like the lyrics that narrates â€˜â€™Itâ€™s  decided that I only belong to youâ€. Inside â€˜Senoritaâ€™ Music Video, they  boys also expressed their passionate love below the hot sun, added with  colorful and South American look-a-like plots. A powerful dance  choreography is also added in VAV rendition of â€˜Senoritaâ€™.  VAV  Korean remake version of Kay Oneâ€™s hit track â€˜Senoritaâ€™ is like a  collaboration of the Latin-POP with K-POP. It is expecting to be a brand  new interpretation where new style and music elements can be found in  VAV up-coming new song â€˜Senoritaâ€™.

Ok for those who want a little context to this song and why German fans are kind of laughing over this comeback, read on.  In Germany we have a TV Series called DSDS which is the German equivalent to America's got Talent I guess. The producer of this song is KayOne. You could best describe him as a whiny SoundCloud Rapper who somehow got fame. He was in the jury of DSDS in 2014. The original singer of this song is Pietro Lombardi. He won DSDS in 2011 and is in the jury of next year's season. He's easily one of the biggest douches in DSDS history. He married the winner of another casting show from the same TV station. They had a big argument over their marriage and their child. Sarah, his ex-wife, recorded parts of it where he threatened her and said shit like "I swear by god, I will fuck you up". Not sure if he beat her but I wouldn't be surprised. The TV station's name is btw RTL. They have a sub channel called RTL2 which is basically the low point of human existence. In shows like "Mitten im Leben" (Slice of Life) do they showcase fucked up people/families. It's all acted but that kind of makes it worse. Imagine "mom is a hoe and the 13 years daughter want to just like her, tries it with a class mate and gets pregnant" That's some RTL2 shit right there. If you want to see it for yourself search "Dome ytk" on YouTube or something. The core audience of thess shows are usually people who are too lazy to work and live of of the government. Eating fastfood all day and somehow their clothes look like they stole them from 2000 red carpet.  So now you know why most German's consider RTL as the scum of German television.  Also most people who watch RTL unironically these days or those kind of people who'll tell you Kpop is gay.  That's also why it's so funny for me and other Germans lol   Btw the song is way better than the original
